questions.text:
#### Q1. Given the string "strawberries" saved in a variable called fruit, what would `fruit.substring(2, 5)` return?

- %OPTION% rawb
- %OPTION% raw
- %OPTION% awb
- %OPTION% traw

**Reasoning:** The substring method is accepting two arguments.

- The first argument being the index to start(includes that char at 2)
- and the second the index of the string to end the substring(excludes the char at 5).
- Strings in Java are like arrays of chars.
- Therefore, the method will return "raw" as those are the chars in indexes 2,3, and 4.
- You can also take the ending index and subtract the beginning index from it, to determine how many chars will be included in the substring (5-2=3).

#### Q2. How can you achieve runtime polymorphism in Java?

- %OPTION% method overloading
- %OPTION% method overrunning
- %OPTION% method overriding
- %OPTION% method calling

#### Q3. Given the following definitions, which of these expression will **NOT** evaluate to true?

`boolean b1 = true, b2 = false; int i1 = 1, i2 = 2;`

- %OPTION% `(i1 | i2) == 3`
- %OPTION% `i2 && b1`
- %OPTION% `b1 || !b2`
- %OPTION% `(i1 ^ i2) < 4`

#### Q15. How do you write a foreach loop that will iterate over ArrayList\<Pencil\>pencilCase?

- %OPTION% `for (Pencil pencil : pencilCase) {}`
- %OPTION% `for (pencilCase.next()) {}`
- %OPTION% `for (Pencil pencil : pencilCase.iterator()) {}`
- %OPTION% `for (pencil in pencilCase) {}`

#### Q16. What does this code print?

```java
System.out.print("apple".compareTo("banana"));
```

- %OPTION% `0`
- %OPTION% positive number
- %OPTION% negative number
- %OPTION% compilation error

#### Q17. You have an ArrayList of names that you want to sort alphabetically. Which approach would **NOT** work?

- %OPTION% `names.sort(Comparator.comparing(String::toString))`
- %OPTION% `Collections.sort(names)`
- %OPTION% `names.sort(List.DESCENDING)`
- %OPTION% `names.stream().sorted((s1, s2) -> s1.compareTo(s2)).collect(Collectors.toList())`

#### Q18. By implementing encapsulation, you cannot directly access the class's \_ properties unless you are writing code inside the class itself.

- %OPTION% private
- %OPTION% protected
- %OPTION% no-modifier
- %OPTION% public

#### Q19. Which is the most up-to-date way to instantiate the current date?

- %OPTION% `new SimpleDateFormat("yyyy-MM-dd").format(new Date())`
- %OPTION% `new Date(System.currentTimeMillis())`
- %OPTION% `LocalDate.now()`
- %OPTION% `Calendar.getInstance().getTime()`

**Explanation**: LocalDate is the newest class added in java 8

#### Q20. Fill in the blank to create a piece of code that will tell whether `int0` is divisible by `5`:

`boolean isDivisibleBy5 = _____`

- %OPTION% `int0 / 5 ? true: false`
- %OPTION% `int0 % 5 == 0`
- %OPTION% `int0 % 5 != 5`
- %OPTION% `Math.isDivisible(int0, 5)`

#### Q22. The runtime system starts your program by calling which function first?

- %OPTION% print
- %OPTION% iterative
- %OPTION% hello
- %OPTION% main

#### Q24. Which statement is **NOT** true?

- %OPTION% An anonymous class may specify an abstract base class as its base type.
- %OPTION% An anonymous class does not require a zero-argument constructor.
- %OPTION% An anonymous class may specify an interface as its base type.
- %OPTION% An anonymous class may specify both an abstract class and interface as base types.

#### Q27. Object-oriented programming is a style of programming where you organize your program around \_ rather than \_ and data rather than logic.

- %OPTION% functions; actions
- %OPTION% objects; actions
- %OPTION% actions; functions
- %OPTION% actions; objects

#### Q28. What statement returns true if "nifty" is of type String?

- %OPTION% `"nifty".getType().equals("String")`
- %OPTION% `"nifty".getType() == String`
- %OPTION% `"nifty".getClass().getSimpleName() == "String"`
- %OPTION% `"nifty" instanceof String`

#### Q31. What method can be used to create a new instance of an object?

- %OPTION% another instance
- %OPTION% field
- %OPTION% constructor
- %OPTION% private method

#### Q32. Which is the most reliable expression for testing whether the values of two string variables are the same?

- %OPTION% string1 == string2
- %OPTION% string1 = string2
- %OPTION% string1.matches(string2)
- %OPTION% string1.equals(string2)

#### Q39. What method signature will work with this code?

`boolean healthyOrNot = isHealthy("avocado");`

- %OPTION% public void isHealthy(String avocado)
- %OPTION% boolean isHealthy(String string)
- %OPTION% public isHealthy("avocado")
- %OPTION% private String isHealthy(String food)

#### Q40. Which are valid keywords in a Java module descriptor (module-info.java)?

- %OPTION% provides, employs
- %OPTION% imports, exports
- %OPTION% consumes, supplies
- %OPTION% requires, exports

#### Q41. Which type of variable keeps a constant value once it is assigned?

- %OPTION% non-static
- %OPTION% static
- %OPTION% final
- %OPTION% private

#### Q42. How does the keyword `volatile` affect how a variable is handled?

- %OPTION% It will be read by only one thread at a time.
- %OPTION% It will be stored on the hard drive.
- %OPTION% It will never be cached by the CPU.
- %OPTION% It will be preferentially garbage collected.

#### Q43. What is the result of this code?

```java
char smooch = 'x';
System.out.println((int) smooch);
```

- %OPTION% an alphanumeric character
- %OPTION% a negative number
- %OPTION% a positive number
- %OPTION% a ClassCastException

#### Q44. You get a NullPointerException. What is the most likely cause?

- %OPTION% A file that needs to be opened cannot be found.
- %OPTION% A network connection has been lost in the middle of communications.
- %OPTION% Your code has used up all available memory.
- %OPTION% The object you are using has not been instantiated.

#### Q47. If you encounter `UnsupportedClassVersionError` it means the code was `___` on a newer version of Java than the JRE `___` it.

- %OPTION% executed; interpreting
- %OPTION% executed; compiling
- %OPTION% compiled; executing
- %OPTION% compiled, translating

#### Q50. Which statements about `abstract` classes are true?

```
1. They can be instantiated.
2. They allow member variables and methods to be inherited by subclasses.
3. They can contain constructors.
```

- %OPTION% 1, 2, and 3
- %OPTION% only 3
- %OPTION% 2 and 3
- %OPTION% only 2

#### Q51. Which keyword lets you call the constructor of a parent class?

- %OPTION% parent
- %OPTION% super
- %OPTION% this
- %OPTION% new

#### Q53. Normally, to access a static member of a class such as Math.PI, you would need to specify the class "Math". What would be the best way to allow you to use simply "PI" in your code?

- %OPTION% Add a static import.
- %OPTION% Declare local copies of the constant in your code.
- %OPTION% This cannot be done. You must always qualify references to static members with the class form which they came from.
- %OPTION% Put the static members in an interface and inherit from that interface.

#### Q54. Which keyword lets you use an interface?

- %OPTION% extends
- %OPTION% implements
- %OPTION% inherits
- %OPTION% import

#### Q55. Why are ArrayLists better than arrays?

- %OPTION% You don't have to decide the size of an ArrayList when you first make it.
- %OPTION% You can put more items into an ArrayList than into an array.
- %OPTION% ArrayLists can hold more kinds of objects than arrays.
- %OPTION% You don't have to decide the type of an ArrayList when you first make it.

#### Q57. Use the magic power to cast a spell

```java
public class MagicPower {
    void castSpell(String spell) {}
}
```

- %OPTION% `new MagicPower().castSpell("expecto patronum")`
- %OPTION% `MagicPower magicPower = new MagicPower();`
      `magicPower.castSpell();`
- %OPTION% `MagicPower.castSpell("expelliarmus");`
- %OPTION% `new MagicPower.castSpell();`

#### Q58. What language construct serves as a blueprint containing an object's properties and functionality?

- %OPTION% constructor
- %OPTION% instance
- %OPTION% class
- %OPTION% method

#### Q61. Which is not a java keyword

- %OPTION% finally
- %OPTION% native
- %OPTION% interface
- %OPTION% unsigned

**Explanation:** `native` is a part of JNI interface

#### Q62. Which operator would you use to find the remainder after division?

- %OPTION% `%`
- %OPTION% `//`
- %OPTION% `/`
- %OPTION% `DIV`

[Reference](http://www.cs.ukzn.ac.za/~hughm/java/intro/week2/21.html)

#### Q63. Which choice is a disadvantage of inheritance?

- %OPTION% Overridden methods of the parent class cannot be reused.
- %OPTION% Responsibilities are not evenly distributed between parent and child classes.
- %OPTION% Classes related by inheritance are tightly coupled to each other.
- %OPTION% The internal state of the parent class is accessible to its children.

[Reference](http://erpbasic.blogspot.com/2012/01/inheritance-advantages-and.html#:~:text=Main%20disadvantage%20of%20using%20inheritance,used%20independent%20of%20each%20other.&text=4.,case%20of%20using%20that%20method.)

#### Q64. How would you declare and initialize an array of 10 ints?

- %OPTION% `Array<Integer> numbers = new Array<Integer>(10);`
- %OPTION% `Array[int] numbers = new Array[int](10);`
- %OPTION% `int[] numbers = new int[10];`
- %OPTION% `int numbers[] = int[10];`

#### Q66. Which functional interfaces does Java provide to serve as data types for lambda expressions?

- %OPTION% Observer, Observable
- %OPTION% Collector, Builder
- %OPTION% Filter, Map, Reduce
- %OPTION% Consumer, Predicate, Supplier

[Reference](https://www.baeldung.com/java-8-functional-interfaces)

#### Q67. What is a valid use of the hashCode() method?

- %OPTION% encrypting user passwords
- %OPTION% deciding if two instances of a class are equal
- %OPTION% enabling HashMap to find matches faster
- %OPTION% moving objects from a List to a HashMap

[Reference](https://www.baeldung.com/java-hashcode)

#### Q68. What kind of relationship does "extends" denote?

- %OPTION% uses-a
- %OPTION% is-a
- %OPTION% has-a
- %OPTION% was-a

[Reference](https://www.c-sharpcorner.com/UploadFile/3614a6/is-a-and-has-a-relationship-in-java/)

#### Q69. How do you force an object to be garbage collected?

- %OPTION% Set object to null and call Runtime.gc()
- %OPTION% Set object to null and call System.gc()
- %OPTION% Set object to null and call Runtime.getRuntime().runFinalization()
- %OPTION% There is no way to force an object to be garbage collected

[Reference](https://sematext.com/blog/java-garbage-collection/)

#### Q70. Java programmers commonly use design patterns. Some examples are the **\_**, which helps create instances of a class, the **\_**, which ensures that only one instance of a class can be created; and the **\_**, which allows for a group of algorithms to be interchangeable.

- %OPTION% static factory method; singleton; strategy pattern
- %OPTION% strategy pattern; static factory method; singleton
- %OPTION% creation pattern; singleton; prototype pattern
- %OPTION% singleton; strategy pattern; static factory method

#### Q71. Using Java's Reflection API, you can use \_ to get the name of a class and \_ to retrieve an array of its methods.

- %OPTION% this.getClass().getSimpleName(); this.getClass().getDeclaredMethods()
- %OPTION% this.getName(); this.getMethods()
- %OPTION% Reflection.getName(this); Reflection.getMethods(this)
- %OPTION% Reflection.getClass(this).getName(); Reflection.getClass(this).getMethods()

#### Q72. Which is not a valid lambda expression?

- %OPTION% `a -> false;`
- %OPTION% `(a) -> false;`
- %OPTION% `String a -> false;`
- %OPTION% `(String a) -> false;`

#### Q73. Which access modifier makes variables and methods visible only in the class where they are declared?

- %OPTION% public
- %OPTION% protected
- %OPTION% nonmodifier
- %OPTION% private

#### Q74. What type of variable can be assigned to only once?

- %OPTION% private
- %OPTION% non-static
- %OPTION% final
- %OPTION% static

#### Q75. How would you convert a String to an Int?

- %OPTION% `"21".intValue()`
- %OPTION% `String.toInt("21")`
- %OPTION% `Integer.parseInt("21")`
- %OPTION% `String.valueOf("21")`

#### Q77. Which operator is used to concatenate Strings in Java

- %OPTION% `+`
- %OPTION% `&`
- %OPTION% `.`
- %OPTION% `-`

[Reference](https://www.techiedelight.com/concatenate-two-strings-java/)

#### Q80. When should you use a static method?

- %OPTION% when your method is related to the object's characteristics
- %OPTION% when you want your method to be available independently of class instances
- %OPTION% when your method uses an object's instance variable
- %OPTION% when your method is dependent on the specific instance that calls it

#### Q81. What phrase indicates that a function receives a copy of each argument passed to it rather than a reference to the objects themselves?

- %OPTION% pass by reference
- %OPTION% pass by occurrence
- %OPTION% pass by value
- %OPTION% API call

#### Q82. In Java, what is the scope of a method's argument or parameter?

- %OPTION% inside the method
- %OPTION% both inside and outside the method
- %OPTION% neither inside nor outside the method
- %OPTION% outside the method

#### Q86. Which code snippet is valid?

- %OPTION% `ArrayList<String> words = new ArrayList<String>(){"Hello", "World"};`
- %OPTION% `ArrayList words = Arrays.asList("Hello", "World");`
- %OPTION% `ArrayList<String> words = {"Hello", "World"};`
- %OPTION% `ArrayList<String> words = new ArrayList<>(Arrays.asList("Hello", "World"));`

#### Q89. Which characteristic does not apply to instances of java.util.HashSet=

- %OPTION% uses hashcode of objects when inserted
- %OPTION% contains unordred elements
- %OPTION% contains unique elements
- %OPTION% contains sorted elements

**Explanation**: HashSet makes no guarantees as to the iteration order of the set; in particular, it does not guarantee that the order will remain constant over time.

[Reference](https://docs.oracle.com/javase/7/docs/api/java/util/HashSet.html)

#### Q91. What will this code print, assuming it is inside the main method of a class?

`System.out.println("hello my friends".split(" ")[0]);`

- %OPTION% my
- %OPTION% hellomyfriends
- %OPTION% hello
- %OPTION% friends

#### Q92. You have an instance of type Map<String, Integer> named instruments containing the following key-value pairs: guitar=1200, cello=3000, and drum=2000. If you add the new key-value pair cello=4500 to the Map using the put method, how many elements do you have in the Map when you call instruments.size()?

- %OPTION% 2
- %OPTION% When calling the put method, Java will throw an exception
- %OPTION% 4
- %OPTION% 3

#### Q93. Which class acts as root class for Java Exception hierarchy?

- %OPTION% Clonable
- %OPTION% Throwable
- %OPTION% Object
- %OPTION% Serializable

#### Q94. Which class does not implement the java.util.Collection interface?

- %OPTION% java.util.Vector
- %OPTION% java.util.ArrayList
- %OPTION% java.util.HashSet
- %OPTION% java.util.HashMap

**Explanation**: HashMap class implements Map interface.

#### Q95. You have a variable of named `employees` of type `List<Employee>` containing multiple entries. The `Employee` type has a method `getName()` that returns te employee name. Which statement properly extracts a list of employee names?

- %OPTION% `employees.collect(employee -> employee.getName());`
- %OPTION% `employees.filter(Employee::getName).collect(Collectors.toUnmodifiableList());`
- %OPTION% `employees.stream().map(Employee::getName).collect(Collectors.toList());`
- %OPTION% `employees.stream().collect((e) -> e.getName());`

#### Q97. Which language feature ensures that objects implementing the `AutoCloseable` interface are closed when it completes?

- %OPTION% try-catch-finally
- %OPTION% try-finally-close
- %OPTION% try-with-resources
- %OPTION% try-catch-close

#### Q100. Which choice is the best data type for working with money in Java?

- %OPTION% float
- %OPTION% String
- %OPTION% double
- %OPTION% BigDecimal

[Reference](https://www.scaler.com/topics/java/primitive-data-types/#types-of-primitive-data-types-in-java)

#### Q101. Which statement about constructors is not ture?

- %OPTION% A class can have multiple constructors with a different parameter list.
- %OPTION% You can call another constructor with `this` or `super`.
- %OPTION% A constructor does not define a return value.
- %OPTION% Every class must explicitly define a constructor without parameters.

#### Q102. What language feature allows types to be parameters on classes, interfaces, and methods in order to reuse the same code for different data types?

- %OPTION% Regular Expressions
- %OPTION% Reflection
- %OPTION% Generics
- %OPTION% Concurrency

#### Q109. Which statement must be inserted on line 1 to print the value true?

```
1:
2: Optional<String> opt = Optional.of(val);
3: System.out.println(opt.isPresent());
```

- %OPTION% `Integer val = 15;`
- %OPTION% `String val = "Sam";`
- %OPTION% `String val = null;`
- %OPTION% `Optional<String> val = Optional.empty();`

#### Q110. What will this code print, assuming it is inside the main method of a class?

```java
System.out.println(true && false || true);
System.out.println(false || false && true);
```

- %OPTION% false </br> true
- %OPTION% true </br> true
- %OPTION% true </br> false
- %OPTION% false </br> false

#### Q112. Which code checks whether the characters in two Strings,named `time` and `money`, are the same?

- %OPTION% `if(time <> money){}`
- %OPTION% `if(time.equals(money)){}`
- %OPTION% `if(time == money){}`
- %OPTION% `if(time = money){}`

#### Q113. An **\_** is a serious issue thrown by the JVM that the JVM is unlikely to recover from. An **\_** is an unexpected event that an application may be able to deal with in order to continue execution.

- %OPTION% exception,assertion
- %OPTION% AbnormalException, AccidentalException
- %OPTION% error, exception
- %OPTION% exception, error

#### Q117. What keyword is added to a method declaration to ensure that two threads do not simultaneously execute it on the same object instance?

- %OPTION% native
- %OPTION% volatile
- %OPTION% synchronized
- %OPTION% lock

[Java Documentation: Synchronized methods](https://docs.oracle.com/javase/tutorial/essential/concurrency/syncmeth.html)

#### Q120. What variable type should be declared for capitalize?

```shell
List<String> songTitles = Arrays.asList("humble", "element", "dna");
_______ capitalize = (str) -> str.toUpperCase();
songTitles.stream().map(capitalize).forEach(System.out::println);
```

- %OPTION% `Function<String, String>`
- %OPTION% `Stream<String>`
- %OPTION% `String<String, String>`
- %OPTION% `Map<String, String>`

[Explanation](https://github.com/0nyr/java/tree/main/training/linkedin_assessment/what_variable_type_0), [Reference](https://www.geeksforgeeks.org/function-interface-in-java-with-examples/)

#### Q121. Which is the correct return type for the processFunction method?

```java
_____ processFunction(Integer number, Function<Integer, String> lambda) {
        return lambda.apply(number);
    }
```

- %OPTION% `Integer`
- %OPTION% `String`
- %OPTION% `Consumer`
- %OPTION% `Function<Integer, String>`

[Explanation](https://github.com/0nyr/java/tree/main/training/linkedin_assessment/which_return_type_0)

#### Q122. What function could you use to replace slashes for dashes in a list of dates?

```java
List<String> dates = new ArrayList<String>();
// missing code
dates.replaceAll(replaceSlashes);
```

- %OPTION% `UnaryOperator<String> replaceSlashes = date -> date.replace("/", "-");`
- %OPTION% `Function<String, String> replaceSlashes = dates -> dates.replace("-", "/");`
- %OPTION% `Map<String, String> replaceSlashes = dates.replace("/", "-");`
- %OPTION% `Consumer<Date> replaceSlashes = date -> date.replace("/", "-");`

**Explanation:** `replaceAll` method for any List<T> only accepts UnaryOperator<T> to pass every single element into it then put the result into the List<T> again.

#### Q123. From which class do all other classes implicitly extend?

- %OPTION% `Object`
- %OPTION% `Main`
- %OPTION% `Java`
- %OPTION% `Class`

[Explanation](https://stackoverflow.com/questions/17187218/default-class-that-is-extended-by-all-classes-in-java)

#### Q125. Which expression is a functional equivalent? ```java List numbers = List.of(1,2,3,4); int total = 0; for (Integer x : numbers) { if (x % 2 == 0) total += x * x; } ``` - %OPTION% A ```java int total = numbers.stream() .transform(x -> x * x) .filter(x -> x % 2 == 0) .sum (); ``` - %OPTION% B ```java int total = numbers.stream() .filter(x -> x % 2 == 0) .collect(Collectors.toInt()); ``` - %OPTION% C ```java int total = numbers.stream() .mapToInt (x -> {if (x % 2 == 0) return x * x;}) .sum(); ``` - %OPTION% D ```java int total = numbers.stream() .filter(x -> x % 2 == 0) .mapToInt(x -> x * x) .sum(); ``` **Explanation:** The given code in the question will give you the output 20 as total ``` numbers // Input `List` > [1, 2, 3, 4]
.stream() // Converts input into `Stream`
.filter(x -> x % 2 == 0) // Filter even numbers and return `Stream` > [2, 4]
.mapToInt(x -> x * x) // Square the number, converts `Integer` to an `int`, and returns `IntStream` > [4, 16]
.sum() // Returns the sum as `int` > 20 ```

#### Q126. Which is not one of the standard input/output streams provided by java.lang.System?

- %OPTION% print
- %OPTION% out
- %OPTION% err
- %OPTION% in

#### Q127. The compiler is complaining about this assignment of the variable pickle to the variable jar. How woulld you fix this?

```java
double pickle = 2;
int jar = pickle;
```

- %OPTION% Use the method toInt() to convert pickle before assigning it to jar.
- %OPTION% Cast pickle to an int before assigning it to jar.
- %OPTION% Make pickle into a double by adding + ".0"
- %OPTION% Use the new keyword to create a new Integer from pickle before assigning it to jar.

#### Q128. What value should x have to make this loop execute 10 times?

```java
for(int i=0; i<30; i+=x) {}
```

- %OPTION% 10
- %OPTION% 3
- %OPTION% 1
- %OPTION% 0

#### Q129. The **\_** runs compiled Java code, while the **\_** compiles Java files.

- %OPTION% IDE; JRE
- %OPTION% JDK; IDE
- %OPTION% JRE; JDK
- %OPTION% JDK; JRE

[Reference](https://stackoverflow.com/questions/1906445/what-is-the-difference-between-jdk-and-jre)

#### Q130. Which packages are part of Java Standard Edition

- %OPTION% java.net
- %OPTION% java.util
- %OPTION% java.lang
- %OPTION% All above

[Reference](https://docs.oracle.com/en/java/javase/11/docs/api/allpackages-index.html)

#### Q132. Which keyword would you add to make this method the entry point of the program?

- %OPTION% exception
- %OPTION% args
- %OPTION% static
- %OPTION% String

[Reference](https://www.geeksforgeeks.org/java-main-method-public-static-void-main-string-args/)

#### Q133. You have a list of Bunny objects that you want to sort by weight using Collections.sort. What modification would you make to the Bunny class?

- %OPTION% Implement the comparable interface by overriding the compareTo method.
- %OPTION% Add the keyword default to the weight variable.
- %OPTION% Override the equals method inside the Bunny class.
- %OPTION% Implement Sortable and override the sortBy method.

[Reference](https://www.geeksforgeeks.org/how-to-override-compareto-method-in-java/)
